text:
14 Gregory Hall Urbana, Illinois Phone EMpire 7-6611, Ext. 3394
The National Association of Educational Broadcasters has received
$42,738 from the W. K. Kellogg Foundation for the year 1959-60.
Dr* Harry J* Skornia, Executive Director of the NAEB, said this
is the first payment of a three-year grant totaling $106,338*
With a Kellogg grant in 1951, the NAEB set up its national headÂ¬
quarters and permanent staff, as well as a national educational
radio network. The network became self-supporting within five years,
and now distributes recorded educational programs at the rate of a
thousand tape recordings a week.
While NAEB headquarters is slowly achieving self-support itself,
part of the present grant will be used to carry on its regular
services* Dr. Skornia said that the funds will allow the NAEB to
hire a full-time editor for its various publications. NAEB will
also use the grant to conduct seminars each year for advanced
training of personnel within the field of educational radio and
television.
July 13, 1959
BM3K/dp
